title: Nike Green Chemistry Program Validation - Material Greening Effort

item.title: Nike Green Chemistry Program Validation - Material Greening Effort

item.text: The goal of the Nike material chemistry program is to protect consumers, workers, the environment and brand reputation.
Represents work toward a systematic, risk-based (hazard and exposure) approach to assessing toxic chemicals in a material or process.
Assesses exposure potential in order to prioritize the elimination of chemicals (through reformulation or control via an RSL program) that pose the greatest risk.
Awards points for evaluating chemical use within a supplier facility and for using processes and technologies that reduce or eliminate toxic chemicals in materials production.

Q: BASIS FOR POINTS/EXPLANATION OF PROGRAM?
A: Based on toxicology results of materials submitted for Green Chemistry Program.

Q: CAN SUPPLIERS INFLUENCE?
A: Yes; supplier can submit material-specific green chemistry achievements for consideration.

Q: WHAT DOES SUPPLIER HAVE TO DO?
A: Submit green chemistry material formulations for evaluation by Nike-approved toxicologist and convey results to Nike Green Chemistry Program Manager.

Q: MATERIAL TYPE RELEVANCE?
A: FW & AP materials
